profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Fishkill, Dutchess County, N.Y., November 20, 1821; attended the common schools and was graduated from Rutgers College, New Brunswick, N.J., in 1838; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1843 and commenced practice in Kingston, Ulster County, N.Y.; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-third Congress (March 4, 1853-March 3, 1855); declined to be a candidate for renomination in 1854; resumed the practice of his profession at Kingston, N.Y.; elected a justice of the supreme court in 1873; died while holding court in Troy, Rensselaer County, N.Y., on October 6, 1885; interment in Wiltwyck Cemetery, Kingston, N.Y.

researchRecord.name: In the Lockwood Collection, 1880-1882, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: Two letters from Theodoric R. Westbrook to Irving Browne written between 1880 and 1882. The letters are housed in a bound volume labeled "Our Native Musses."

parentRecordLocation.name: University at Buffalo, State University of New York
